title: U.S. disposable personal income - monthly percentage of change 2019/20
summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The maximum Month Jan '20 has got 60000000000.0 times higher Monthly percentage of change than the minimum Month Oct '19.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Monthly percentage of change for 13 number of Months.
Month Jan '20 has the highest Monthly percentage of change and Oct '19 has the lowest Monthly percentage of change.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
The Monthly percentage of change is highest at Month Jan '20 and lowest at Month Oct '19.
The maximum Month Jan '20 has got 60000000000.0 times higher Monthly percentage of change than the minimum Month Oct '19.
max_summary: This bar chart has 13 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Monthly percentage of change in each Month on the y axis.
Month Jan '20 has the highest Monthly percentage of change and Oct '19 has the lowest Monthly percentage of change.
There is a difference of 0.6 between the maximum Month Jan '20 and minimum Month Oct '19.
Month Jan '20 is higher than any other Months with value 0.6, followed by Aug '19, and Feb '19. Down to Month Oct '19 with the lowest value 0.0.
Overall Monthly percentage of change has lowered over the Months.
Similar Monthly percentage of change is found in Month Nov '19, Jun '19, Apr '19, and Mar '19.
The Month Oct '19 tends to be 1.73 percent lower than average.
The Monthly percentage of change is 4.5 if we add up values of all Months.
